intro: Mapouria guianensis, commonly known as the Guianan mapouria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, opposite leaves, and clusters of small, tubular flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. The species is valued for its ornamental qualities and has traditional uses in some indigenous communities.
